Summary: Three red lights in V shape
trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Malone
There were no other sightings in Malone on or around September 24th 2009
divs: sighting detailswhile watching the night sky with a group, i noticed 3 red lights in a broad "v" formation. they were noticed because there had been 2 or 3 known aircraft passing by just before the lights were seen, and some of the group thought this was another aircraft. no other lights on the object were seen, as in no strobe or navigation lights. the lights were passing from roughly east to west. they stayed the same position and distance relative to each other. there was no sound. i am unable to provide good estimates as to altitude, size, or distance to the object, due to a lack of reference points. the distance from the object was probably over 1 mile. the inclination was approximately 45 to 75 degrees. i will say, however, that if the object was at cruising altitude for a commercial aircraft, it would have been very large - much larger than any known aircraft - based on the distance between the two outer lights. the object was in view for approximately 2 minutes. there was no change in speed, altitude, or direction. the object stayed in constant sight until it was obscured by some trees. the lights were steady (not blinking) with the center and forward-most light perhaps a little dimmer than the other 2. the night was very clear, with minimal man-made light pollution. the area i was in was farmland, with some trees. there was about a 1\3 moon, with the moon behind me and hidden by trees. i had from the first thought it to be a ufo of some type. i grew up in the airline industry, and have lived near airports and air force bases for many years, plus have over 2o years military experience - 10 of which were in the air force. i have a good grasp of what aircraft should look like, and this did not fit anything i've seen before.
